briefTitle: The BASE Study: Bicarbonate Administration to Stabilize Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
officialTitle: The BASE Study: Bicarbonate Administration to Stabilize eGFR
summary: The two doses of sodium bicarbonate being tested are 0.5 and 0.8 mEq/kg-lean body weight (LBW) per day. Sodium bicarbonate, also known as baking soda, may help prevent kidney failure in people with chronic kidney disease. However, the dose to prescribe in order to test this possibility in a clinical trial is uncertain. The BASE pilot clinical trial will help determine the best dose of sodium bicarbonate to prescribe in a future study that will test the long-term safety and efficacy of sodium bicarbonate as a treatment to preserve kidney function in individuals with chronic kidney disease.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants in Each Dose Arm Prescribed (i) Full Randomized Sodium Bicarbonate Dose at End of 28 Weeks & (ii) at Least 25% of Randomized Sodium Bicarbonate Dose at End of 28 Weeks as a Proportion of the Number Randomized to That Group
